Articles.Content:
I just wondered what your favorite moon in the game is! This light not seem fair but i'm going to keep laythe out since it's so immensly popular! Mine is gilly. So vote up people!

Edited November 29, 2013 by panzerknoef
The MÃƒÂ¼n!
I am just starting to send some missions to Gillly, the only place it seems practical to use Ion engines.

You've wrote Minmus wrong. It's Minmus, not Minimus.

I like Minmus and Gilly, but I'll vote for Minmus.
Laythe....
Of course its the Mun.
Minmus... awesome flat surfaces, very low gravity and minty; I'm getting hungry now
I'm sorry since polls can't be edited it'll be minimus for now. Maybe an admin can change that?
Gilly,lowest gravity available. Its fun there.

I dont really have any interest in laythe at all. I find it too similar to Kerbin and it is filled with water to make landings hard.. I also like Ike as it has amazing views of Duna and looks like grey play dough XD

I really love Vall, the scenery is just so awesome.

Also, I've fixed the typo in Minmus

The MÃƒÂ¼n is awesome! Canyons, craters, hole on the pole, anomalies! Also, it is the only moon I have ever landed on other then Gilly. Ike would be a close runner up, and I might of chose it if I landed there. It is tidally locked to Duna, and is almost impossible not to get a encounter. Vall would also be close, with amazing views of Jool and the other moons. It is also beautiful. Then Laythe, simply because of the view and the ability to use jets.

You know, I'm just going to vote for Pol, show it a little love. I've got this weird longing to go back there after having visited it only once, and it's certainly one of the most unique places in the game. That said, the rest of the moons are essentially on par, for me anyway, because they all offer something different; Mun for being like our own Moon, Minmus for the lakes, and Jool's moons for some of the best views in the game, to give a few examples.

I too like Pol.

So much so I have a base there.

Can I down vote Tylo.

Good lord I hate that rock. Perpetually in the way and screwing up my orbits around Jool.

Not laythe?? *Looks at armada of ships about to arrive at Laythe*

Umm, maybe Vall?

I really love Vall, the scenery is just so awesome.

Also, I've fixed the typo in Minmus

Hurrah thank you sir
Minmus for me, flat surfaces. Also it's quite easy to see everything as well, which is a problem at times with the Mun
Pol, like a multi coloured gilly

LOL nobody likes Bop yet.. just like Bob!

Edited November 27, 2013 by Force21
yeah no love for Bop this time! lolololol
Ike too, because it is so near to duna. And when stay at duna and it is directly above you, it look like it is dancing around a fix point.
Gilly. Is. POTATO

I voted Tylo.

I mostly just like the challenge of landing there. It's also the best moon for setting up huge slingshots with.

If we go by number of missions, mine would be MÃƒÂ¼n, simply because it's easier to get to and I'm working up to my first kerballed landing Apollo-style, along the way simulating in some respects the Apollo program in general (learning the ins and outs of FRT, discovering just how much ÃŽâ€V it takes (by way of not having enough) to enter orbit and then return to Kerbin, etc.).

But really I much prefer Minmus. That little ball of minty ice cream is just so much prettier, and more delicious! Maybe I'll change me mind in the future when I finally leave Kerbin's local system and explore other planets and moons, but for now Minmus is my favorite!

All of the asteroid moons get my vote, really. Though Gilly in particular since it has crazy-low gravity. Any body you're at serious risk of putting yourself in orbit around by doing a long jump is way okay in my books.
